Tetapi dengan kehendak Allah mereka semuanya menjadi umat yang bersatu di bawah panji-panji iman, bersedia mengorbankan harta dan jiwa untuk menegakkan kalimah Allah. Ini adalah satu karunia dari Allah yang tidak ternilai harganya yang tidak dapat dicapai walaupun dengan mengorbankan semua harta dan kekayaan. Kesatuan hati, kesatuan tekad dan kesatuan cita-cita dan ideologi adalah hal yang amat penting dan berharga untuk mencapai satu cita-cita. Inilah karunia Allah yang telah dimiliki oleh kaum Muslimin pada masa itu. Karena pentingnya karunia itu dan amat tinggi nilainya Allah mengingatkan mereka agar selalu mengingat Allah dengan firman-Nya:

Dan ingatlah nikmat Allah kepadamu ketika kamu dahulu (masa jahiliah) bermusuhan, lalu Allah mempersatukan hatimu, sehingga dengan karunia-Nya kamu menjadi bersaudara. (Ali 'Imran/3: 103)

Maka dengan pertolongan Allah dan persatuan kaum Muslimin serta rasa cinta, kasih sayang yang terjalin antara sesama mereka, betapa pun kesulitan dan bagaimana pun besar bahaya yang akan menimpa tentu akan dapat ditanggulangi dan diatasi. Allah memperingatkan pula dalam ayat ini bagaimana tingginya nilai persatuan itu, sehingga bila Nabi Muhammad sendiri menghabiskan semua kekayaan yang ada di bumi untuk mencapainya pasti dia tidak akan berhasil. Tetapi Allah telah mempersatukan hati mereka dengan iman yang kuat dan rasa kasih-sayang yang tinggi. Ini adalah satu tanda bahwa Allah meridai kaum Muslimin dan merestui perjuangan mereka dan mereka tidak perlu merasa khawatir sesungguhnya Allah Mahaperkasa lagi Mahabijaksana.

text.64:
Pada ayat ini Allah mengulangi kembali jaminan-Nya kepada Nabi Muhammad, bahwa Allah akan menolongnya dengan bantuan kaum Muslimin yang benar-benar beriman dan yakin sepenuhnya bahwa Allah bersama mereka. Menurut riwayat dari Ibn Abbas, ayat ini turun sehubungan dengan masuk Islamnya Umar, menyusul Islamnya 33 orang laki-kali dan enam orang perempuan, seperti dikemukakan Jubair (lihat Tafsir al-Kabir, Jilid VIII, hlm 197-198). Dengan keimanan dan keyakinan itu tekad mereka tak akan digoyahkan oleh kejadian atau ancaman apa pun. Keimanan dan keyakinan itu digambarkan Allah dalam firman-Nya:

(Yaitu) orang-orang (yang menaati Allah dan Rasul) yang ketika ada orang-orang mengatakan kepadanya, "Orang-orang (Quraisy) telah mengumpul-kan pasukan untuk menyerang kamu, karena itu takutlah kepada mereka," ternyata (ucapan) itu menambah (kuat) iman mereka dan mereka menjawab, "Cukuplah Allah (menjadi penolong) bagi kami dan Dia sebaik-baik pelindung." (Ali 'Imran/3: 173)

Maka dengan keyakinan dan tekad yang bulat yang ditimbulkan oleh keimanan dan jaminan Allah, kaum Muslimin siap untuk menerima perintah Allah, bagaimana pun berat dan sulitnya, meskipun dengan perintah itu mereka akan menghadapi musuh yang banyak atau bahaya yang besar.
text.65:
Allah memerintahkan kepada Rasul-Nya agar mengobarkan semangat kaum Muslimin untuk berperang menghadapi musuh dalam peperangan. Nabi melaksanakan perintah ini dengan mendorong para sahabat untuk maju berperang seperti dalam menghadapi Perang Badar. Meskipun jumlah tentara kafir Quraisy dari Mekah sangat banyak, dan perlengkapan mereka lebih baik, tetapi Nabi mendorong orang-orang yang beriman dengan mengatakan, "Qumu ila jannatin 'ardzuha as-samawat wa al-ard (Bangkitlah kamu semua maju ke medan perang yang menyediakan surga yang luas, seluas langit dan bumi)." 

Dalam ayat ini Allah juga menegaskan bahwa kekuatan pasukan Muslim yang benar-benar beriman dan penuh tawakal kepada Allah akan dapat mengalahkan kekuatan musuh meskipun sepuluh kali lipat banyaknya. Andaikata pasukan kaum Muslimin hanya terdiri dari dua puluh orang prajurit, mereka dapat mengalahkan pasukan musuh yang terdiri dari dua ratus orang. Jika pasukan mereka terdiri dari seratus orang, mereka dapat mengalahkan pasukan musuh yang terdiri dari seribu orang, demikianlah seterusnya, setiap prajurit Allah dapat mengalahkan sepuluh musuh. Ini adalah satu perbandingan kekuatan yang tidak ada taranya dalam sejarah, karena cara peperangan pada masa itu bukan seperti peperangan pada masa kini.

Peperangan pada masa sekarang sangat tergantung kepada kekuatan persenjataan dan kesempurnaannya. Pasukan yang kecil jumlah orangnya, yang diperlengkapi dengan senjata modern yang ampuh dapat saja dengan mudah mengalahkan pasukan besar tetapi hanya mempunyai senjata biasa saja.

Peperangan pada masa itu benar-benar dengan mengadu kekuatan dan kecakapan karena alat-alat perang yang digunakan boleh dikatakan sama macam dan mutunya. Tidaklah mungkin rasanya suatu pasukan kecil akan dapat menang atas pasukan besar yang jumlahnya sepuluh kali lipat. Tetapi inilah yang ditegaskan Allah atau diperintahkan-Nya kepada kaum Muslimin. Mereka tidak boleh merasa gentar dan takut menghadapi lawan yang berlipat-ganda, karena mereka adalah orang-orang beriman yang berjuang bukan untuk kepentingan diri sendiri, atau untuk mencari harta benda dan kemegahan duniawi, tetapi mereka adalah tentara Allah yang berjuang untuk membela kebenaran; untuk meninggikan kalimah Allah dan untuk kejayaan agama yang telah diridai-Nya. Bila mereka gugur dalam pertempuran, mereka akan mati syahid, balasannya di sisi Allah tidak ternilai besarnya. 

Lawan-lawan kaum Muslimin adalah orang-orang kafir yang hanya ingin mempertahankan kedudukan, pangkat dan harta benda. Mereka tidak mempunyai tujuan hidup yang tinggi dan mulia karena mereka tidak percaya kepada Tuhan Yang Maha Esa dan tidak percaya kepada hari kebangkitan. Hidup mereka adalah untuk berbangga-bangga dan mengutamakan harta benda belaka. Adapun orang Yahudi di Medinah meskipun percaya kepada Tuhan Yang Maha Esa, tetapi mereka tidak dapat lagi melihat kebenaran, karena mata mereka telah disilaukan oleh kesenangan dunia. Mereka ingin hidup, kalau dapat seribu tahun, mereka telah karam dalam dunia kebendaan, tak dapat luput dari sifat loba dan serakah. Kedua golongan ini benar-benar telah sesat dari jalan yang hak, tidak dapat lagi membedakan mana yang hak, mana yang bathil, mereka tidak tahu lagi jalan yang membawa kepada kebahagiaan dunia dan akhirat. Orang dengan sifat demikian ini bila dihadapkan kepada pertempuran yang dahsyat mereka akan lari tunggang langgang karena lebih mengutamakan hidup daripada mati. Hal ini dijelaskan Allah dengan firman-Nya:

Sesungguhnya dalam hati mereka, kamu (muslimin) lebih ditakuti daripada Allah. Yang demikian itu karena mereka orang-orang yang tidak mengerti. (al-hasyr/59: 13) 

Kalau Allah memerintahkan agar kaum Muslimin berani menghadapi musuh Allah yang berjumlah sepuluh kali jumlah mereka dan menyatakan bahwa mereka akan menang, maka kemenangan itu adalah pasti meskipun tidak pernah terjadi sebelumnya dalam sejarah. Karena itu mereka tidak boleh melarikan diri dari pertempuran dan harus bertempur mati-matian sampai tercapai kemenangan. Inilah derajat yang paling tinggi yang dapat dicapai oleh kaum Muslimin.
text.66:
Pada ayat ini Allah memberikan keringanan bagi kaum Muslimin dalam menghadapi musuh yang menyerang mereka. Kalau pada ayat 65 Allah memerintahkan agar mereka berani menghadapi musuh yang berjumlah sepuluh kali lebih besar dari jumlah mereka, maka pada ayat ini dijelaskan bahwa mereka diberi keringanan karena mereka telah berada dalam keadaan lemah, baik dalam semangat maupun dalam persiapan perang. Dalam keadaan seperti ini mereka diharuskan menghadapi musuh yang jumlahnya dua kali jumlah mereka. Ini adalah suatu tingkat minimal yang harus mereka pertahankan, karena keringanan yang diberikan ini sudah banyak sekali dibanding dengan perintah semula dan tak ada alasan lagi untuk meminta keringanan lebih banyak lagi. Dengan keimanan yang kuat dan ketabahan serta keyakinan penuh akan mencapai kemenangan. Hal ini terbukti ketika mereka menghadapi kaum musyrikin pada Perang Badar. Kekuatan mereka kurang sepertiga kekuatan musuh, tetapi mereka dapat menghancurkan kaum musyrikin itu.

Pada Perang Yarmuk jumlah tentara yang dikumpulkan oleh kaisar Heraklius, kerajaan Romawi Timur, untuk menghadapi tentara kaum Muslimin, tidak kurang dari 200.000 (dua ratus ribu) orang, sedang tentara kaum Muslimin yang dikirim para sahabat hanya 24.000 (dua puluh empat ribu) orang saja. Berkat keimanan yang kokoh, kuat, dan semangat yang tinggi kaum Muslimin dapat mengalahkan musuh yang banyak itu. Diriwayatkan bahwa tentara Romawi yang mati pada pertempuran itu berjumlah 70.000 (tujuh puluh ribu) orang. Semua kemenangan yang diperoleh kaum Muslimin itu adalah sesuai dengan kehendak dan seizin Allah sebagai bukti bagi kebenaran ini. Allah berfirman:

Betapa banyak kelompok kecil mengalahkan kelompok besar dengan izin Allah. Dan Allah beserta orang-orang yang sabar. (al-Baqarah/2: 249)
text.67:
Ayat ini sebagai teguran terhadap keputusan Rasulullah menerima tebusan dari kaum musyrikin untuk membebaskan orang-orang mereka yang ditawan kaum Muslimin. Beliau condong kepada pendapat kebanyakan para sahabat yang menganjurkan agar para tawanan itu jangan dibunuh dan sebaiknya diterima saja uang tebusan dari mereka dan hasil tebusan itu dapat dipergunakan untuk kepentingan perjuangan dan persiapan perang bila musuh menyerang kembali. Karena itu Allah menegaskan dalam ayat ini bahwa tidak patut bagi seorang Nabi dalam suatu peperangan menahan para tawanan dan menunggu putusan, apakah mereka akan dibebaskan begitu saja atau dengan menerima tebusan dari keluarga mereka, kecuali bila keadaan pengikut-pengikutnya, sudah kuat kedudukannya, dan musuhnya tidak berdaya lagi. Keadaan kaum Muslimin sebelum Perang Badar masih lemah dan kekuatan mereka masih terlalu kecil dibanding dengan kekuatan kaum musyrikin. Bila para tawanan itu tidak dibunuh, malah dibebaskan kembali meskipun dengan membayar tebusan, sedang mereka adalah pemuka dan pemimpin kaumnya, tentulah mereka akan kembali menghasut, dan mengumpulkan kekuatan yang besar untuk menyerang kaum Muslimin. Hal ini sangat berbahaya bagi kedudukan kaum Muslimin yang masih lemah. Seharusnya mereka tidak ditawan, tetapi langsung dibunuh di medan perang, sehingga dengan tewasnya para pembesar dan pemimpin itu kaum musyrikin akan merasa takut dan tidak berani lagi menyerang kaum Muslimin. Firman Allah dalam Surah Muhammad/47: 4): 

Maka apabila kamu bertemu dengan orang-orang yang kafir (di medan perang) maka pukullah batang leher mereka. Selanjutnya apabila kamu telah mengalahkan mereka tawanlah mereka dan setelah itu kamu boleh membebaskan mereka atau menerima tebusan sampai perang selesai. Demikianlah, dan sekiranya Allah menghendaki niscaya Dia membinasakan mereka tetapi Dia hendak menguji kamu satu sama lain. Dan orang-orang yang gugur di jalan Allah, Allah tidak menyia-nyiakan amal mereka. (Muhammad/47: 4) 

Ayat ini bukan saja merupakan teguran kepada Nabi Muhammad, tetapi juga merupakan teguran kepada para sahabat dan kebanyakan kaum Muslimin yang menganjurkan agar para tawanan itu jangan dibunuh, karena mereka itu adalah kaum kerabat dan famili dan mungkin kelak akan menjadi orang yang beriman, apalagi uang tebusan mereka dapat dipergunakan untuk kepentingan mereka sendiri. Dengan anjuran ini mereka telah melakukan tindakan yang bertentangan dengan siasat perang. Apa pun alasan yang mereka kemukakan, mereka telah dipengaruhi harta benda duniawi dan dengan tidak disadari mereka telah lupa dan tidak memikirkan lagi akibat dari pelaksanaan anjuran itu. Oleh sebab itu Allah dengan tegas menyatakan bahwa mereka menginginkan harta benda dan kehidupan duniawi, sedang Allah menghendaki agar mereka mencari pahala untuk di akhirat nanti dengan berjuang di jalan-Nya, meninggikan kalimat-Nya sampai kemuliaan dan ketinggian agama-Nya tercapai, sebagaimana tersebut dalam firman-Nya:

Padahal kekuatan itu hanyalah bagi Allah, Rasul-Nya dan bagi orang-orang mukmin. (al-Munafiqun/63: 8)

Inilah cara yang dikehendaki Allah bagi orang-orang yang beriman dan berjuang dengan harta, dan segala kemampuan yang ada pada mereka bahkan dengan jiwa untuk mencapainya. Allah senantiasa akan menolong mereka. Sesungguhnya Allah Mahaperkasa lagi Mahabijaksana.
text.68:
Pada ayat ini Allah menerangkan bahwa tindakan kaum Muslimin menerima tebusan itu adalah tindakan yang salah. Kalau tidak karena ketetapan Allah yang telah ada sebelumnya bahwa Dia tidak akan menimpakan siksa kepada mereka karena kesalahan itu, tentulah mereka akan mendapat azab yang berat. 

Mengenai yang dimaksud dengan "ketetapan Allah yang telah ada untuk menyelamatkan kaum Muslimin dari siksaan karena kekhilafan itu" para mufasir mengemukakan beberapa ayat di antaranya firman Allah:

Tetapi Allah tidak akan menghukum mereka, selama engkau (Muhammad) berada di antara mereka. Dan tidaklah (pula) Allah akan menghukum mereka, sedang mereka (masih) memohon ampunan. (al-Anfal/8: 33)

Meskipun ayat ini mengenai kaum musyrikin, tetapi kaum Muslimin lebih berhak atas ketetapan itu. Sedang kaum musyrikin yang sesat dan durhaka dapat selamat dari siksaan Allah dengan keberadaan Nabi di kalangan mereka, apalagi kaum Muslimin yang taat dan setia selalu membantu Nabi dan selalu meminta ampunan kepada Allah, tentu mereka lebih pantas tidak ditimpa siksa yang berat itu. Firman Allah:

Tuhanmu telah menetapkan sifat kasih sayang pada diri-Nya, (yaitu) barang siapa berbuat kejahatan di antara kamu karena kebodohan, kemudian dia bertobat setelah itu dan memperbaiki diri, maka Dia Maha Pengampun, Maha Penyayang. (al-An'am/6: 54)
text.69:
Allah Maha Pengampun lagi Maha Penyayang terhadap hamba- hamba-Nya, maka dengan sifat mulia ini Allah mengampuni dan tidak menimpakan siksaan kepada kaum Muslimin, bahkan memberikan hak kepada mereka untuk memakan dan memiliki harta rampasan yang didapat dalam peperangan termasuk uang tebusan itu sebagaimana tersebut dalam riwayat berikut ini:

Diriwayatkan bahwa pada mulanya kaum Muslimin tidak mau mempergunakan harta tebusan yang dibayar oleh kaum musyrikin, karena takut akan tersalah lagi apabila belum ada wahyu yang mengizinkan mereka memanfaatkannya, maka turunlah ayat ini. Ini adalah suatu bukti lagi bagi mereka atas rahmat dan kasih sayang Allah kepada mereka. Sesudah mereka melakukan kesalahan, mereka diampuni dan dibebaskan dari siksaan atas kesalahan itu, kemudian diizinkan pula memakan dan memiliki hasil dari tindakan salah itu, yaitu uang tebusan yang mereka terima dari para tawanan. Allah menegaskan bahwa harta yang didapat dari penebusan tawanan itu adalah halal dan baik, bukan seperti daging babi dan bangkai. Kemudian Allah menyuruh mereka agar selalu bertakwa kepada-Nya dengan mengerjakan segala perintah-Nya dan menjauhi semua larangan-Nya, karena Dialah Yang Maha Pengampun dan Maha Penyayang.
text.70: Ayat ini memerintahkan kepada Rasulullah agar mengatakan kepada para tawanan yang merasa berat hatinya mengeluarkan harta untuk penebus diri mereka bahwa Allah akan mengganti harta yang mereka serahkan itu dengan yang lebih baik dan lebih bersih serta beriman kepada Allah. Allah akan mengampuni segala dosa termasuk syirik, memusuhi kaum Muslimin, memusuhi Islam, agama yang diridai-Nya dan melakukan berbagai macam tindakan yang dimurkai-Nya. Allah adalah Maha Pengampun dan Maha Penyayang terhadap hamba-Nya.
text.71:
Dengan keterangan yang diberikan Rasulullah kepada para tawanan itu sebagaimana yang diperintahkan Allah, banyak di antara mereka yang menyatakan masuk Islam dan tidak memusuhi lagi Nabi Muhammad saw beserta kaum Muslimin. Tetapi Allah memperingatkan dan menggembirakan hati Nabi akan sikap mereka selanjutnya dengan menerangkan pada ayat ini bahwa bila ada di antara mereka itu yang mengkhianati janjinya dengan kembali kepada kufur atau menyerang kaum Muslimin, maka Nabi tak perlu merasa gusar dan bersedih hati. Hal itu sudah lumrah dan biasa terjadi pada manusia. Bila dalam keadaan susah dan terdesak ia mengucapkan kata-kata yang manis dan mengemukakan janji yang muluk-muluk, tetapi bila berada dalam suasana aman dan baik ia mengingkari semua janjinya dan berbalik menjadi musuh yang lebih jahat lagi. 

Begitulah sifat sebagian kaum Musyrikin itu, karena sifat itu telah menjadi darah daging dalam tubuhnya. Sedang Allah Yang Mahakuasa dan Mahaperkasa telah mereka khianati dengan mempersekutukan-Nya dan menyembah berhala serta melakukan perbuatan yang tidak diridai-Nya. Karena pengkhianatan terhadap Allah inilah maka Dia memberikan kemenangan kepada kaum Muslimin, seperti yang terjadi pada Perang Badar, padahal kaum musyrikin itu lebih banyak jumlahnya dan lebih lengkap persenjataannya. Allah Maha Mengetahui segala apa yang tersimpan dalam hati mereka, dan Mahabijaksana dalam memberikan balasan terhadap apa yang diperbuat manusia, yang baik dibalas dengan pahala dan yang buruk dibalas dengan siksa.
text.72:
Pada ayat ini disebutkan tiga golongan kaum Muslimin:

Golongan pertama ialah yang memperoleh derajat tertinggi dan mulia di sisi Allah yaitu kaum Muhajirin yang hijrah bersama Nabi Muhammad saw ke Medinah dan orang-orang yang menyusul kemudian yaitu hijrah sebelum terjadinya Perang Badar. Kemudian sebagian ahli tafsir berpendapat termasuk juga dalam golongan ini orang-orang yang hijrah sebelum terjadinya perdamaian Hudaibiyah tahun ke-6 Hijri. Golongan pertama ini di samping perjuangannya di Medinah bersama-sama kaum anshar, telah berjuang pula sebelumnya di Mekah menghadapi kaum musyrikin yang kejam, yang tidak segan-segan melakukan kekerasan dan penganiayaan terhadap orang yang beriman pada agama yang dibawa Nabi Muhammad saw. Semua kekerasan dan kekejaman yang ditimpakan kepada kaum muhajirin ini diterima dengan sabar dan tabah dan tidak dapat menggoyahkan keimanan mereka sedikitpun. Mereka tetap bertahan dan berjuang membela agama yang hak dan bersedia berkorban dengan harta dan jiwa, bahkan mereka bersedia meninggalkan kampung halaman, anak, istri dan harta benda mereka. Oleh sebab itu mereka diberi sebutan oleh Allah dengan keistimewaan, pertama: "Beriman", kedua: "Berhijrah", ketiga: "Berjuang" dengan harta dan benda di jalan Allah".

Golongan kedua ialah "kaum Anshar" di Medinah yang memeluk agama Islam, beriman kepada Nabi saw dan mereka berjanji kepada Nabi dan kaum Muhajirin akan bersama-sama berjuang di jalan Allah, bersedia menanggung segala resiko dan derita perjuangan, untuk itu mereka siap berkorban dengan harta dan jiwa. Nabi Muhammad saw menanamkan rasa ukhuwah Islamiah antara kedua golongan ini sehingga kaum Anshar memandang kaum Muhajirin sebagai saudara kandung, yang masing-masing golongan dapat mewarisi. Allah memberikan dua sebutan kepada mereka, pertama: "Memberi tempat kediaman" dan kedua: "Penolong" karena hal ini pula mereka dinamai "Kaum Anshar". Seakan-akan kedua golongan ini karena akrabnya hubungan telah menjadi satu, sehingga tidak ada lagi perbedaan hak dan kewajiban di antara mereka. Karena itu Allah telah menetapkan bahwa hubungan antara sesama mereka adalah hubungan karib kerabat, hubungan setia kawan, masing-masing merasa berkewajiban membantu dan menolong yang lainnya bila ditimpa suatu bahaya atau malapetaka. Mereka saling menolong, saling menasehati dan tidak akan membiarkan orang lain mengurus urusan mereka. Hanya dari kalangan merekalah diangkat pemimpin bilamana mereka membutuhkan pemimpin yang akan menanggulangi urusan mereka. 

Sahabat Anas meriwayatkan bahwa Rasulullah saw telah mengikat kaum Muhajirin dan kaum Anshar dalam suatu sumpah setia di rumahku. Hadis ini diriwayatkan oleh Anas kepada orang yang bertanya tentang hadis: "Tidak ada perjanjian sumpah setia dalam Islam".

Golongan ketiga ialah golongan kaum Muslimin yang tidak hijrah ke Medinah. Mereka tetap saja tinggal di negeri yang dikuasai oleh kaum musyrik seperti orang mukmin yang berada di Mekah dan beberapa tempat di sekitar kota Medinah. Mereka tidak dapat disamakan dengan kedua golongan Muhajirin dan Anshar karena mereka tidak berada di kalangan masyarakat Islam, tetapi berada di kalangan masyarakat musyrikin. Maka hubungan antara mereka dengan kaum Muslimin di Medinah tidak dapat disamakan dengan hubungan antara mukmin Muhajirin dan Anshar dalam masyarakat Islam. Kalau hubungan antara sesama mukmin di Medinah sangat erat bahkan sudah sampai hubungan karib kerabat dan keturunan, maka hubungan dengan yang ketiga ini hanya diikat dengan keimanan saja. Bila terhadap mereka dilakukan tindakan yang tidak adil oleh kaum musyirikin, maka kaum Muslimin di Medinah tidak berdaya membela mereka karena mereka berada di negeri orang-orang musyrik, dan tidak ada hak bagi kaum Muslimin Medinah untuk campur tangan urusan dalam negeri kaum musyrikin. Andaikata mereka hijrah tentulah mereka akan bebas dari perlakuan sewenang-wenang dan tidak wajar itu. Adapun orang-orang mukmin yang tertawan oleh kaum musyrikin maka harus dibebaskan oleh kaum mukminin dengan segala daya upaya karena berdiamnya mereka di negeri kaum musyrikin bukanlah atas kehendak mereka, tetapi dalam keadaan terpaksa dan tidak dapat melarikan diri dari sana. Tetapi bila golongan ketiga ini minta tolong kepada kaum mukminin karena mereka ditindas dan dipaksa agar meninggalkan agama mereka atau ditekan dan selalu dihalangi dengan kekerasan dalam mengamalkan syariat Islam, maka kaum Muslimin diwajibkan memberikan pertolongan kepada mereka, bahkan kalau perlu dengan mengadakan serangan dan peperangan, kecuali bila antara kaum mukminin dan kaum musyrikin itu ada perjanjian damai atau perjanjian tidak saling menyerang. Demikianlah hubungan antara dua golongan pertama dengan golongan ketiga ini, yang harus diperhatikan dan diamalkan dan mereka harus bertindak sesuai dengan ketentuan-ketentuan yang telah ditetapkan Allah. Allah selalu melihat dan mengetahui apa yang dilakukan oleh hamba-Nya (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim). Adapun golongan keempat akan diterangkan pada ayat 75.
text.73: Pada ayat ini Allah menegaskan bahwa semua orang kafir meskipun berlainan agama dan aliran, karena ada di antara mereka yang musyrik, Nasrani, Yahudi dan sebagainya, dan meskipun antara mereka sendiri terjadi perselisihan dan kadang-kadang permusuhan, mereka semua bisa menjadi kawan setia antara sesama mereka dalam berbagai urusan. Sebagian mereka menjadi pemimpin bagi yang lain bahkan kadang-kadang mereka sepakat untuk memusuhi dan menyerang kaum Muslimin seperti terjadi pada perang Khandaq. Pada waktu turunnya ayat ini, dapat dikatakan bahwa yang ada di Hijaz hanya kaum musyrikin dan Yahudi. Orang Yahudi sering mengadakan persekutuan dengan kaum musyrikin dan menolong mereka dalam memusuhi kaum Muslimin bahkan kerap kali pula mengkhianati perjanjian sehingga mereka diperangi oleh kaum Muslimin dan diusir dari Khaibar ke luar kota Medinah. Jadi kaum Muslimin harus menggalang persatuan yang kokoh dan janganlah sekali-kali mereka mengadakan janji setia dengan mereka atau mempercayakan kepada mereka mengurus urusan kaum Muslimin, karena hal itu akan membawa kepada kerugian besar atau malapetaka. Allah memperingatkan bila hal ini tidak diindahkah maka akan terjadilah fitnah dan kerusakan di muka bumi.
text.74:
Pada ayat ini Allah menerangkan kelebihan kaum Muhajirin dan Anshar atas kaum Muslimin yang lain. Mereka diberi predikat orang-orang yang benar-benar beriman, yakni orang yang telah sempurna imannya. Hal itu telah mereka buktikan dengan perbuatan yang nyata semenjak dari turunnya wahyu kepada Nabi Muhammad sampai berdirinya pemerintah Islam di Medinah. Orang Anshar telah berkorban dengan segala kesanggupan baik dengan harta benda maupun dengan jiwa untuk menegakkan agama Allah. Kalau tidaklah pertolongan dan bantuan sepenuhnya dari mereka belum tentu kaum Muhajirin akan dapat membina kekuatan Islam dengan sempurna. Berkat keimanan dan persatuan yang kuat antara kedua golongan ini dan kerja sama yang erat antara mereka, terwujudlah kekuatan yang hebat yang tak bisa dilumpuhkan oleh musuh-musuh Islam meskipun kekuatan mereka berlipat ganda banyaknya. Karena kelebihan mereka itu pulalah Allah menjanjikan bagi mereka ampunan dari segala kesalahan yang mereka perbuat sebelumnya dan bagi mereka disediakan pula di akhirat kelak rezeki yang tidak pernah putus yaitu surga yang penuh dengan nikmat yang tiada taranya.

Untuk menjelaskan derajat tiga golongan yang pertama, kedua dan ketiga yang memiliki beberapa keutamaan ini, Allah berfirman:

(Harta rampasan itu juga) untuk orang-orang fakir yang berhijrah yang terusir dari kampung halamannya dan meninggalkan harta bendanya demi mencari karunia dari Allah dan keridaan(-Nya) dan (demi) menolong (agama) Allah dan Rasul-Nya. Mereka itulah orang-orang yang benar. (al-hasyr/59: 8)

Dan firman Allah:

Dan orang-orang (Ansar) yang telah menempati kota Medinah dan telah beriman sebelum (kedatangan) mereka (Muhajirin), mereka mencintai orang yang berhijrah ke tempat mereka. Dan mereka tidak menaruh keinginan dalam hati mereka terhadap apa yang diberikan kepada mereka (Muhajirin); dan mereka mengutamakan (Muhajirin), atas dirinya sendiri, meskipun mereka juga memerlukan. Dan siapa yang dijaga dirinya dari kekikiran, maka mereka itulah orang-orang yang beruntung. (al-hasyr/59: 9)

Dan firman-Nya:

Dan orang-orang yang datang sesudah mereka (Muhajirin dan Anshar), mereka berdoa, "Ya Tuhan kami, ampunilah kami dan saudara-saudara kami yang telah beriman lebih dahulu dari kami, dan janganlah Engkau tanamkan kedengkian dalam hati kami terhadap orang-orang yang beriman. Ya Tuhan kami, Sungguh, Engkau Maha Penyantun, Maha Penyayang." (al-hasyr/59: 10)
text.75:
Pada ayat ini disebutkan golongan keempat yaitu orang-orang yang terlambat masuk Islam, terlambat beriman dan terlambat pula hijrah. Tetapi meskipun demikian mereka dapat ikut berjuang dengan ikhlas bersama kaum Muslimin. Mereka bersedia pula berkorban dengan harta dan jiwa seperti kawannya yang lebih dahulu masuk Islam. Karena itu mereka bukanlah tergolong "pahlawan kesiangan," sebaliknya mereka dapat digolongkan ke dalam golongan Muhajirin dan Anshar meskipun derajat mereka di sisi Allah tidak setinggi derajat golongan pertama dan kedua ini. 

Untuk menjelaskan ketinggian derajat kaum Muhajirin dan Anshar itu Allah berfirman:

Tidak sama orang yang menginfakkan (hartanya) di jalan Allah di antara kamu dan berperang sebelum penaklukan (Mekah). Mereka lebih tinggi derajatnya daripada orang-orang yang menginfakkan (hartanya) dan berperang setelah itu. Dan Allah menjanjikan kepada masing-masing mereka (balasan) yang lebih baik. Dan Allah Mahateliti apa yang kamu kerjakan. (al-hadid/57: 10)

Dan firman-Nya lagi:

Orang-orang yang terdahulu lagi pertama-tama (masuk Islam) di antara orang-orang Muhajirin dan Anshar dan orang-orang yang mengikuti mereka dengan baik. Allah rida kepada mereka dan merekapun rida kepada Allah dan Allah menyediakan bagi mereka surga-surga yang mengalir sungai-sungai di bawahnya, mereka kekal di dalamnya selama-lamanya. Itulah kemenangan yang agung. (at-Taubah/9: 100)

Sebagai penutup ayat ini, Allah menerangkan kedudukan ulul arham (karib kerabat) dibandingkan dengan kedudukan kaum Muslimin umumnya. Ulul arham yang mukmin lebih dekat kepada seseorang dari kaum Muslimin lainnya, baik dari kaum Muhajirin maupun Anshar. Oleh sebab itu, merekalah yang lebih berhak menerima pertolongan, kesetiakawanan, dan mengurus berbagai urusan. Karena itu pula, wajib dibina hubungan antara mereka dengan saling menolong, waris mewarisi, dan mengangkat mereka menjadi wali dalam pernikahan dan sebagainya. Diriwayatkan bahwa Rasulullah saw pernah bersabda:

Mulailah (berbuat baik) kepada dirimu sendiri, maka beri nafkahlah dirimu lebih dahulu. Bila masih ada yang akan engkau nafkahkan berikanlah kepada keluargamu. Bila masih ada lagi sesudah memberi keluargamu berikanlah kepada karib kerabatmu. Dan bila masih ada lagi sesudah memberi karib kerabatmu, maka bertindaklah seperti itu, yakni ada yang lebih berhak daripada yang lain, dan demikianlah seterusnya. (Riwayat an-Nasa'i dari Jabir)

Dalam Al-Qur'an banyak pula terdapat firman Allah yang mendahulukan kedudukan karib kerabat yang terdekat yaitu ayah ibu dengan menyebutkan mereka pertama-tama kemudian baru diiringi dengan yang terdekat yakni ulul arham dan seterusnya, firman Allah:

Dan berbuatbaiklah kepada kedua orang tua, kerabat, anak-anak yatim, dan orang-orang miskin. Dan bertutur katalah yang baik kepada manusia. (al-Baqarah/2: 83)

Mendahulukan orang tua dan karib kerabat dalam berbuat baik tidak berarti agama Islam mengajarkan atau mengizinkan nepotisme. Nepotisme sangat mengutamakan saudara dan karib kerabat serta teman-teman dekatnya dengan mengorbankan hak orang lain, baik dalam pengangkatan jabatan-jabatan tertentu dan dalam pemberian beberapa fasilitas (kemudahan) dengan menyisihkan orang lain yang juga berhak mendapatkannya. Nepotisme justru dilarang agama karena bertentangan dengan prinsip keadilan, sebab agama memerintahkan pemeluknya untuk selalu menegakkannya. Keadilan harus ditegakkan terhadap diri sendiri, terhadap orang tua, dan karib kerabat. Firman Allah dalam Surah an-Nisa/4: 135 menegaskan sebagai berikut:

Wahai orang-orang yang beriman! Jadilah kamu penegak keadilan, menjadi saksi karena Allah, walaupun terhadap dirimu sendiri atau terhadap ibu bapak dan kaum kerabatmu. Jika dia (yang terdakwa) kaya ataupun miskin, maka Allah lebih tahu kemaslahatan (kebaikannya). Maka janganlah kamu mengikuti hawa nafsu karena ingin menyimpang dari kebenaran. Dan jika kamu memutarbalikkan (kata-kata) atau enggan menjadi saksi, maka ketahuilah Allah Mahateliti terhadap segala apa yang kamu kerjakan. (an-Nisa/4: 135)

Demikianlah seterusnya hubungan di antara orang-orang mukmin dan demikianlah tingkat dan derajat mereka di sisi Allah. Hendaklah hal ini diperhatikan sebaik-baiknya agar kaum Muslimin dapat hidup tenteram dan bahagia, karena yang menetapkan tata tertib ini adalah Allah Yang Maha Mengetahui segala sesuatu.

en.name: The Spoils of War
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1:
This verse discusses the issue of war booty obtained by the Muslims after the Great Battle of Badr. This war ended with the victory of the Muslims. They obtained a large amount of war booty.

Al-Anfal (al-Ganimah) is all kinds of property obtained by the Muslims from the enemy on the battlefield. This war booty is called al-Anfal (plural of Nafal) because this property became the wealth of the Muslims.

After the Muslims obtained the war booty, a difference of opinion arose among those who participated in the war. The dispute concerned the methods of distribution, and which parties were entitled to receive it. Whether the youth or the elders, the Muhajirin or the Ansar, or whether each party received an equal share. The matter was brought to the Messenger of Allah (saw) to obtain a fair decision.

As an answer to the question of the Muslims, Allah commanded the Messenger of Allah (saw) to establish the law, that the war booty is the right of Allah and His Messenger. Therefore, those who determine the distribution of the war booty are not the youth group or the elderly group, not the Muhajirin or the Ansar, not the attacking team, the protecting team, or the war booty collecting team, but Allah who determines it with the revelation revealed to His Messenger. The Messenger of Allah (saw) divided the war booty equally among the Muslims.

In this provision, there is a high lesson for the Muslims so that they do not assume that the war booty they obtain is a reward for war services, but solely because of Allah's grace. If they assume that the war booty is obtained as a reward for services, then their struggle is not purely for Allah and following the command of His Messenger. This verse also encourages the Muslims, so that in facing heavy responsibilities, they should face them together, and if they receive blessings, they should be felt together as well.

Regarding the detailed distribution of war booty, the interpretation will be explained in verse 41 of this surah. Allah also commanded the Messenger of Allah (saw) that the Muslims should be pious, avoid disputes and conflicts that cause distress and plunge them into Allah's wrath. Piety is needed in every situation, especially in war and the distribution of war booty, the consequences of disputes can be felt, namely the disruption of unity and the emergence of division which results in defeat.

After that, Allah commanded the Muslims to improve relations with fellow Muslims, namely to establish love and strengthen unity of opinion. This is what can bind them in unity of movement in achieving common goals, namely to exalt the word of Allah. Unity and solidarity become the basis of the strength of the ummah in all fields. That is why improving relations among fellow Muslims is obligatory, so that the Muslims realize the importance of avoiding dangers that threaten them, the danger of cracks that shake the unity of the ummah. This is clearly illustrated when disputes occur among groups because one feels more meritorious than the other. Likewise, this happens because they forget their important task, namely that the task of defending the truth is a shared task.

At the end of the verse, Allah affirms that the Muslims must obey Allah and the Messenger, in this case obeying the provisions of war, which were conveyed to the Messenger of Allah (saw) through revelation. Allah's provisions must be obeyed, He is the Lord of all the worlds and the Almighty, while obedience to the Messenger, in religious matters, means obedience to Allah because he is the one who conveys the religion and provides explanations contained in his words, deeds and decisions.

This command is emphasized when the Muslims are in dispute regarding the distribution of war booty, to remind them that in whatever circumstances the Muslims must remain obedient to Allah and His Messenger, so that they do not cause division because of group ambitions and the desires of lust, which usually plunge them into destruction.

In this verse, there are several important elements that can maintain the unity of the ummah, namely; piety, improving relations with fellow Muslims, and obeying Allah and the Messenger in every situation.
text.2:
Allah explains that the believers are those who adorn themselves with the characteristics mentioned in this verse. Three characteristics are mentioned in this verse, while two more characteristics are mentioned in the following verse.

1. When the name of Allah is mentioned, their hearts tremble because they remember His greatness and power. At that moment, a feeling of deep emotion arises in their souls, remembering the magnitude of His blessings and grace. They feel afraid if they do not fulfill their duties as servants of Allah, and feel guilty if they violate His prohibitions.

The trembling of the heart as a metaphor for the feeling of fear is an abstract mental attitude that can only be felt by the person concerned and only Allah Himself knows it. While others can know by observing the outward signs of the person who feels it, which are reflected in his words or gestures.

This mental attitude sometimes appears in words, as depicted in the word of Allah:

"And those who give what they give (charity) with their hearts full of fear, (because they know) that they will return to their Lord." (al-Muminun/23: 60)

And sometimes it appears in gestures in actions, the word of Allah:

"When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." He (Abraham) said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you." (al-Hijr/15: 52)

2. When the verses of Allah are recited, their faith increases, because these verses contain strong arguments that affect their souls in such a way that they become more convinced and steadfast and can understand the content, while their limbs are moved to carry it out.

In this verse, there is a guidance that a person's faith can increase and decrease according to his knowledge and deeds. The Messenger of Allah said:

"Faith has more than 70 branches, the highest of which is the acknowledgment that there is no god but Allah, and the lowest of which is removing obstacles from the road." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Hurairah)

Thus, the increase in faith in a person can be known if he is more active in doing good deeds. Faith and deeds are a unified whole that cannot be separated.

The word of Allah swt:

Those to whom hypocrites said, "Indeed, the people have gathered against you, so fear them." But it (merely) increased them in faith, and they said, "Sufficient for us is Allah, and [He is] the best Disposer of affairs." (ali Imran/3: 173)

And the word of Allah:

And when the believers saw the confederates, they said, "This is what Allah and His Messenger had promised us, and Allah and His Messenger spoke the truth." And it increased them only in faith and acceptance. (al-Ahzab/33: 22)

3. To put one's trust (tawakal) only in Allah the One and Only, not surrendering to anyone else. Tawakal is the last weapon of a person in realizing a series of deeds after various means and necessary conditions have been prepared. This can be understood, because in essence all kinds of activities and actions are only realized according to the prevailing laws that are subject to the power of Allah. So it is not right for someone to surrender to other than Allah.
text.3:
Allah explains the outward characteristics of the believers as a continuation of the characteristics that have been mentioned previously.

4. Always establishing the five daily prayers perfectly, fulfilling all the conditions and pillars, and on time, while their souls are *khusyu'* (humbly submissive) following the outward movements and submitting solely to Allah.

5. Spending a portion of the wealth that has been given to them. What is meant by spending wealth in this verse includes paying *zakat*, providing sustenance to close or distant family, or assisting social activities and religious interests, as well as the benefit of the *ummah* (community).
text.4:
Allah affirms that those who adorn themselves with these qualities are the true believers. Ibn Hazm explains that these qualities are those that others can know from them. Therefore, if a person knows that he has believed in Allah, in His Messenger Muhammad (peace be upon him), and believes that what the Prophet brought is true, and that person declares all these acknowledgments with his tongue, then he is obligated to say that he has become a true believer.

At the end of the verse, Allah explains the reward that will be received by the believers who truly believe and adorn themselves with the qualities that have been mentioned, namely that they will obtain high degrees and a noble position in the sight of Allah, solely because of Allah's power. If Allah is able to create all kinds of life forms, then He is also able to give advantages to His creatures according to His will.

These high degrees can be in the form of advantages in life in this world and can be in the form of advantages in the Hereafter, or both. Allah says:

"Those who have believed, emigrated and striven in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives are greater in rank in the sight of Allah. It is they who are the attainers [of success]." (at-Taubah/9:20)

And the word of Allah:

"And it is He who has made you successors upon the earth and has raised some of you above others in degrees [of rank]." (al-Anam/6: 165)
text.5:
Allah explains that He regulates the spoils of war fairly, just as Allah commanded them to go to war to defend Allah's religion fairly as well. Then arose differences of opinion regarding the spoils of war, similar to the differences of opinion when they went to face the caravan led by Abu Sufyan or the infidel Quraysh forces that came from Mecca to defend Abu Sufyan's caravan.

If some people dislike Allah's decree regarding the distribution of spoils of war, then that is a sign that their faith is not yet perfect, just as it happened before the Battle of Badr. They did not follow the commands of Allah and His Messenger, reluctant to leave their homes to fight on the battlefield because they were not yet perfect believers.

At the end of the verse, Allah explains that some of the believers were not pleased with the Prophet Muhammad's decision to attack the enemy outside the city. This was because their war preparations were not complete. However, such an assumption is not correct, because no matter what difficulties they would face, they should not refuse, because it had become a decision that must be obeyed.

The dispute that occurred among them is mentioned in the following narration:

"After the Messenger of Allah heard the news that Abu Sufyan bin Harb was bringing a caravan of camels from Syria, the Prophet mobilized the Muslims to intercept it. The Prophet said, "This caravan carries wealth (merchandise), so go and face it, perhaps Allah will make that wealth spoils of war for you." So the companions moved. Among the Muslims, some did not object, and some did object, because they were not sure that the Messenger of Allah (saw) would face a war, while Abu Sufyan, when approaching the Hijaz, had mobilized several people to spy, to obtain information by asking the travelers he met, so he obtained news from them that Muhammad had mobilized his companions to intercept his caravan. So Abu Sufyan hired Amdham bin Amr al-Giffari to go to Mecca and order him to meet the Quraysh people so that they would send people to protect their wealth and to convey the news that Muhammad had intercepted the wealth. So Amdham bin Amr went immediately to Mecca, and the Messenger went with his companions until he reached the valley called Â¨afran. After he arrived at the wadi, the news of the departure of the Quraysh people reached him to protect their caravan. Therefore, the Messenger of Allah consulted with his companions. Then Abu Bakr stood up and gave a good response. After that, Miqdad bin Amir stood up and said, "O Messenger of Allah! Carry out what Allah has commanded, we are always with you. By Allah, we will not say to you what the Children of Israel said to Moses, 'Go you and your Lord and fight, indeed we are only sitting here waiting,' but go you together with your Lord, then surely we will be with you, by the God who sent you with the truth. If you take us to Barkil Gimad (a city in Habasyah), we will still be with you to that city, until you reach it." Then the Messenger of Allah (saw) said good words and prayed for him with a good prayer. After that, the Messenger of Allah (saw) said, "O people, give me your consideration." The words were addressed to the Ansar people. This was because they had pledged allegiance to the Prophet at Aqabah. They said, "O Messenger of Allah! Indeed, we have protected you as we protect our children and our wives." The Messenger of Allah (saw) was actually worried that the Ansar people would not feel the need to help him, unless the enemy attacked the city, and they did not feel obligated to defend the Prophet if the Prophet attacked. So after the Messenger of Allah (saw) said that, Saad bin Muadh said, "By Allah! Apparently, you mean us (the Ansar)." The Prophet replied, "Yes." Then Saad said, "Indeed, we have believed in you and have justified your religion, and have witnessed that what you brought has given an agreement to be obeyed, so carry out what Allah has commanded. So by the God who sent you with the truth, if you invite us to cross the sea, surely we will cross it, none of us will object and none will deny it, if you invite us to face the enemy tomorrow morning. Indeed, we are people who are steadfast in war and sincere in facing the enemy.

May Allah show you what pleases your heart." So go with us under the protection of Allah. The Messenger of Allah was pleased with Saad's opinion and his agility in facing the war. Then the Messenger of Allah (saw) said, "Go under the protection of Allah and rejoice that Allah has promised victory between the two lines of the enemy. By Allah, it is as if we see the enemy in a state of prostration." (Narrated by Ibn Ishaq from Ibn Abbas)
text.6: Allah explains that among the believers, there were those who disputed the decision that had been made, namely the decision to attack the enemy coming from Mecca under the leadership of Abu Jahal, even though the decision was the clear truth and they had been promised victory by Allah wherever they were. However, they shied away from that decision, because they preferred to confront the group of enemies under the leadership of Abu Sufyan. They refused to fight the enemy forces coming from Mecca and were described by Allah as if they were being driven to death. They gave the reason that they had not prepared everything for war. In this case, they seemed to be trying to twist the understanding that the promise of victory that Allah would give to the Muslims was the caravan of Abu Sufyan. That is why Allah describes their condition as if they were seeing the causes of death. If viewed from the perspective of war strategy, the Prophet's decision to face the Quraish army, even though they were equipped with sufficient war equipment, was correct, because if the Prophet's attack had been directed at the group of camels coming from Syria, the Muslims would have become an easy target for the Quraish army who came to protect Abu Sufyan, because the Quraish could have struck the Muslims from behind. This is because the Quraish army had already suspected that the Muslims were ready to intercept Abu Sufyan's camel caravan.
text.7:
In this verse, Allah reminds the Muslims of an important event, namely when Allah promised victory to the Muslims against one of the two groups they faced: either the camel caravan carrying merchandise or the Quraysh army carrying complete war equipment. At that time, the Muslims tended to choose to face the caravan carrying merchandise, which numbered no more than 40 camels. This is an allusion to some of the Muslims who were afraid of being involved in war, but they wanted to obtain a lot of wealth.

This tendency of theirs was far from the truth, because their goal had turned to material pleasure. They had deviated from upholding monotheism (tauhid) and destroying polytheism (kemusyrikan). That is why Allah explained to them that what Allah wanted was not what they wanted. Allah wanted the Muslims to uphold the truth in accordance with the revelation that had been revealed to His Messenger, which stated that victory would be obtained by the Muslims from one of the two groups. The target of the battle that should be chosen was not explained in order to train the Muslims to be able to make choices and determine war strategies by responding to the situation and assessing it through consultation (musyawarah) and educating them to obey the results of the decision.

Then Allah emphasized His will, namely to destroy the polytheists who rebelled against the religion of Allah in its entirety, including their supporters. Allah describes the destruction of the entire army of the disbelieving Quraysh with the expression "the destruction of the rear ranks," which is the most difficult task, which can only be carried out if the front ranks have been destroyed first. The main purpose of this war was to destroy the polytheists because the victory of the Muslims against them in the Battle of Badr was the first victory that would be followed by other victories in subsequent battles, and ending with the conquest of Mecca as a total and glorious victory for the Muslims and the complete destruction of the disbelieving Quraysh.
text.8:
Allah explains to the Muslims that the victory they obtained was none other than so that the truth of the Islamic religion would stand tall and the falsehood of shirk would vanish from the face of the earth. This is the main goal that Muslims must choose when waging war.

The goal of upholding the Islamic religion and destroying shirk will not be achieved unless the Muslims can defeat the Quraysh army that came from Mecca with complete war equipment with the aim of destroying the Muslims.

At the end of the verse, Allah affirms that the goal of upholding the Islamic religion and destroying shirk will surely be realized, no matter how fierce the enmity and hatred of the polytheists.
text.9:
Allah reminds the Muslims of His help that was given to them when they faced difficulties and tried to overcome those difficulties by praying to Allah SWT so that Allah would grant them help in facing His enemies, because their efforts to overcome the difficulties with outward efforts were not possible. In reality, the strength of the Islamic army at that time consisted of 313 people, while the polytheist army numbered 1000, especially when viewed from the aspect of weaponry. They brought more complete war equipment than the equipment of the Muslims. After that, Allah granted the prayers of the Muslims by sending reinforcements in the form of angels who came in succession.

Regarding Allah's help to the Muslims with a large number of 3,000 angels, it is explained in another verse, namely with the word of Allah:

(Remember) when you (Muhammad) said to the believers, "Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down (from the sky)?" (ali Imran/3: 124)

And the word of Allah SWT:

"Yes," if you persevere patiently and remain conscious of God, and the enemy comes upon you [suddenly], your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks [of distinction]. (ali Imran/3: 125)

Regarding Allah's help, namely angels whose numbers differ as mentioned in these verses, the mufassir (commentators) have different opinions:

For those who believe that these verses concern the story of the Battle of Badr, then it should be understood that Allah SWT initially helped the Muslims with a thousand angels. After that, this assistance was supplemented with three thousand angels. This assistance, given in succession, with an ever-increasing number, was to give a stronger impression on the enemy's mentality, so that they would feel more afraid in the war.

But for those who understand that these two verses are the story of Uhud, then the number 3,000 would be given to the Muslims, and even if they were patient, they would be given assistance from five thousand more angels. But this was a promise, but because they were not obedient, the promise was not fulfilled by Allah.
text.10:
This verse provides an explanation that Allah only sent reinforcements as good news, namely so that the Muslims would be at peace because of it, and have a high fighting spirit and a strong conviction that victory would be obtained as Allah had promised, and also to avoid mental turmoil, be free from fear because of seeing the number of forces, and have strong endurance and conviction in achieving a glorious victory.

This verse also explains that the victory they obtained was not because of strength and weaponry, but solely because of Allah's help, and only Allah can provide help by sending armies of angels. This statement of Allah is very important for the Muslims, so that they do not feel arrogant and conceited when facing the enemy. Because these two traits can eliminate caution and control over oneself in warfare.

At the end of this verse, Allah emphasizes that indeed Allah is All-Powerful and All-Wise. All-Powerful means having the power to grant victory to the Ummah of Muhammad according to what He wills. While All-Wise means granting victory to His servants who adhere to monotheism (tauhid) and destroying His servants who fall into polytheism (shirk).
text.11:
Allah explains to the Muslims that in addition to providing assistance in the form of angels arriving in succession, He also provided other assistance in the form of situations and conditions that were favorable to the Muslims. Such as Allah's help when the Muslims were in fear facing the enemy, they were enveloped in drowsiness, so they could no longer feel fear. The fear was caused by seeing the large number of enemy troops and their complete preparations. So with the drowsiness, they no longer felt fear and they became calm again.

To provide a broader picture of the Muslims' drowsiness during the battle, we can follow the hadith narrated by Abu Yala and al-Baihaqi from Ali, who said:

"We had no cavalry troops in the Battle of Badr except Al-Miqdad. We all fell asleep, except the Messenger of Allah (saw), he prayed under a tree until morning." (Narrated by Abu Yala and al-Baihaqi from Ali)

According to the meaning of the verse that can be understood, the drowsiness occurred during the battle. The drowsiness eliminated fear and trepidation. Consequently, the feeling of fear in the face of danger disappeared.

This is similar to the event that occurred to them during the Battle of Uhud, as mentioned in Allah's word:

"Then after sorrow, He sent down upon you security [in the form of] drowsiness overcoming a faction of you..." (ali-Imran/3: 154)

After that, Allah swt mentions His other help to the Muslims, namely during the Battle of Badr, Allah swt sent down rain upon the Muslims from the sky, so that they could purify themselves with it. A description of Allah swt's intention in sending down rain to the Muslims, and what the wisdom behind it is, can be seen from the hadith narrated by Ibn Mundhir through Ibn Jarir from Ibn Abbas:

"At the beginning of the battle, the polytheists had taken control of the water sources before the Muslims, so the Muslims became thirsty. They prayed in a state of *junub* and *hadas* (without purifying themselves with water). While around them was only sand. Then they were tempted by Satan, as if Satan said, "Do you think that there is a Prophet among you and you are the guardians of Allah. While you pray in a state of *junub* and *hadas*?" Therefore, Allah swt sent down rain from the sky, so that water flowed in the valley. So the Muslims drank water and purified themselves with it and their hearts were strengthened, and their doubts disappeared." (Narrated by Ibn Mundhir from Ibn Abbas)

Allah also explains that He sent down rain from the sky to eliminate the disturbances of Satan and to eliminate fear and doubt, because the Muslims at that time were in a disadvantageous position. They were in a desert area that was not strategic as a defensive stronghold, because it was difficult to move their feet, let alone launch an attack, and there was no water source in the area.

From another perspective, Allah explains that with the rain, it was easy for them to walk on the desert sand, so they gained stability and full confidence to be able to defend and attack the enemy and to unite their fighting power.

Thus, the purpose of Allah sending down rain from the sky in the Battle of Badr was:

1. To give the Muslims the opportunity to purify themselves from *junub* and *hadas* so that they can worship in a state of inner and outer purity.

2. To eliminate the doubts whispered by Satan, and eliminate the fear due to the lack of water supply.

3. So that the Muslims are free to regulate movement in battle, because they are no longer disturbed by the soft sand that interferes with foot movement.
text.12: In this verse, Allah reminds the Muslims of His help, another instance being during the Battle of Badr, when Allah SWT revealed to the angels to provide assistance to the Muslims. The angels were commanded by Allah to accompany the Muslims so that they could provide assistance from time to time. This assistance was to strengthen the hearts of the Muslims in battle. And to convince them that Allah would create fear in the hearts of the disbelievers, because they saw the number of angels accompanying the Islamic army. Thus, the Muslims were able to control the battle, they could advance swiftly, and they could easily break the enemy's attacks.
text.13:
Allah explains the reasons for the victory of the Muslims and the defeat of the polytheists, which is because of Allah's help given to the Muslims in facing the polytheists and their struggle was based on truth, namely upholding the religion of monotheism (tauhid). Meanwhile, the polytheists suffered defeat because they were hostile to Allah and His Messenger, and their struggle was based on falsehood, namely the struggle to defend idols.

Allah swt gives a stern warning to anyone who opposes Allah and His Messenger, whether challenging His laws or denying the blessings given to them, that Allah will inflict punishment upon them. The hostility of the polytheists towards Allah and His Messenger took the form of their challenge to the Prophet's call when conveying the Islamic da'wah. At that time, the Messenger of Allah was not only denied and insulted, but he was even expelled from his country, causing him to migrate to Medina. Meanwhile, they held firmly to the religion of their ancestors, namely the religion of shirk and idol worship. After the Prophet Muhammad saw was in Medina with his companions, they tried to eliminate the Muslims from the face of the earth and eliminate the teachings of Islam. Therefore, they deserved to be given a severe punishment, namely their defeat in the Battle of Badr and the punishment of Allah that will be inflicted upon them, namely the punishment of the fire of hell in the hereafter.
text.14: Allah SWT affirms His threat to the disbelievers that the worldly punishment inflicted upon them is a punishment that must be felt as a recompense for their denial of Allah's laws and blessings. In addition, Allah affirms that for them there is also a more painful torment to be felt, namely the torment of the fire of Hell that will be inflicted upon them in the Hereafter.
text.15:
Allah calls upon the believers that when facing the disbelievers who are coming to attack, the Muslims are forbidden from fleeing the battle.

The disbelievers moved from Mecca bringing a large number of troops. They deliberately met the Muslims who were already at Badr. They already knew the Muslims' plan to intercept the caravan led by Abu Sufyan under the pretext of protecting their trade. They moved from Mecca, even though they actually intended to annihilate the Muslims. That is why Allah SWT forbade the Muslims from turning their backs on them. Especially fleeing from battle against them, even though they brought a large army and complete war equipment.

What is forbidden is fleeing from battle, without a justified reason because of fear of facing the enemy. Whereas retreating to strategize is not included in the prohibition contained in this verse.
text.16:
Allah threatens the Muslims who flee from battle that they will return carrying the wrath of Allah. This wrath of Allah is in the form of a threat that will be inflicted upon them, namely that they will be punished with Hell, a terrifying abode.

From this verse, it can be understood that fleeing from battle is a major sin. The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said:

"Avoid the seven destructive sins." They asked: "What are the seven destructive sins, O Messenger of Allah?" The Prophet replied: "Associating partners with Allah (shirk), practicing magic, killing a person whom Allah has forbidden to kill, except for a just cause, consuming riba (interest), consuming the property of an orphan, fleeing from the battlefield, and accusing chaste, believing women who are unaware of any evil." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Hurairah)

In this regard, Allah explains several exceptions to turning one's back on the enemy and fleeing from battle, namely if the Muslims, during the time of war, retreat to strategize, such as seeking a more advantageous position in the battle, luring the enemy to chase them out of the battlefield to a more strategic location so that the enemy can be destroyed, or by creating deceptive maneuvers to throw the enemy's targets into chaos, or by dividing the troops to attack from all directions, so that the enemy's unity can be broken, and so on.

Muslims, when war is raging, flee to join another unit so that the target of the battle is stronger or to obtain assistance from troops when the enemy is considered to have a stronger force.
text.17:
From Ibn Abbas, that the Messenger of Allah commanded Ali bin Abi Talib: "Take a handful of earth." Ali took it and gave it to the Prophet, who then threw it at the polytheists, and there was not one of them who was not hit in the eye. Then this verse was revealed.

Then Allah gives an explanation regarding the reason why Muslims are forbidden from turning their backs on the enemy, which is because victory will not be achieved by the Muslims except by advancing to attack the enemy, throwing spears, or throwing handfuls of earth at them.

From the victory and help of Allah, it can be understood that every time a Muslim plants a spear to kill an enemy and every handful of earth thrown by them is guaranteed to hit its target, because Allah is the One who guarantees and helps them.

Allah says:

"Fight them; Allah will punish them by your hands and will disgrace them and give you victory over them and satisfy the breasts of a believing people." (at-Taubah/9: 14)

In addition to that, a favorable condition for the Muslims is the belief that their struggle will be victorious, and Allah will help them. Whereas the goal of the disbelievers is only to obtain worldly satisfaction.

Allah says:

"And do not weaken in pursuit of the enemy. If you should be suffering - so are they suffering as you are, while you expect from Allah that which they expect not." (an-Nisa/4: 104)

The word of Allah:

"How many a small company has overcome a large company by permission of Allah." (al-Baqarah/2: 249)

Allah explains that all kinds of help given to the Muslims in the Battle of Badr is a strong reason for Allah's prohibition to the Muslims from fleeing from battle, and is a gift of victory given by Allah to the believers, namely victory and abundant spoils of war.

At the end of the verse, Allah affirms that Allah is All-Hearing to every request of His servant who truly carries out His commands and avoids His prohibitions, and is All-Knowing of all kinds of whispers in the hearts of His servants and knows who among His servants deserves victory and who deserves defeat.
text.18:
Allah affirms that the blessings He bestows upon the Muslims are intended to weaken the schemes of the disbelievers and to weaken their attacks on the Prophet and all Muslims. It is also to build the attention of the Muslims to continue striving to uphold the religion of *tauhid* and to do good to one another in defending and upholding the religion.

From this verse, it can be understood that Allah always protects every struggle of the Muslims in upholding the religion of *tauhid* and will weaken the struggles of the polytheists in every movement and step they take that is aimed at fighting those who uphold the religion of *tauhid* and spread the religion of Islam.
text.19:
After that, Allah gave a statement addressed to the polytheists that if they wanted to seek a decision as to which of the two armies was the most superior and most guided, thus achieving victory, then it was clear that the army that achieved glorious victory was the most superior and most guided.

This statement is a mockery of the polytheists because at the end of the Battle of Badr, victory was clearly obtained by the Muslims, while they, the polytheists, experienced destruction and defeat.

This statement applies at all times and places, wherever and whenever there is turmoil between two groups, victory will certainly be obtained by the group that stands on correct principles.

Then Allah called upon the polytheists that if, after suffering defeat in the Battle of Badr, they stopped opposing Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his followers, then that would actually be better for them.

This offer was put forward by Allah to them because they had experienced the bitterness of war. From that experience, they had seen the reality that no matter how strong and how numerous the troops they mobilized and the war equipment they relied on, they ultimately suffered defeat.

If they disobeyed this call and returned to opposing and fighting the Messenger and his followers, then the reality they experienced would be repeated, namely Allah would again give His help to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him).

Allah affirmed that the polytheists' armed forces, no matter how strong, would not be able to ward off the disaster that Allah would inflict upon them. This shows that a large number of soldiers does not always determine the course of war, unless that large number is accompanied by strength of soul and faith in Allah Azza wa Jalla.

No matter how persistent Abu Jahl and his followers were in defeating the Muslims in the Battle of Badr, they did not succeed, as explained by the Hadith narrated by Ahmad and an-Nasai:

"O Allah, whoever among us has severed the ties of kinship and brought a religion that is not known, then destroy him before dawn," so that is as a request for victory from him (for the Messenger). (Narrated by Ahmad and an-Nasai).

According to the narration of as-Suddi, which comes from Mujahid, it is narrated that before the Quraysh troops departed for the battlefield, they prayed:

The polytheists, when leaving the city of Mecca towards Badr, held onto the curtains of the Kaaba and then they asked Allah for victory and said: "O Lord, grant victory to the army that is the highest (in rank), to the most noble group, and to the best qibla." Then the verse was revealed: If you (polytheists) seek a decision.
text.20:
Allah calls upon the believers to obey Allah and His Messenger. Obeying Allah and His Messenger in this verse means carrying out jihad, striving to defend the religion of monotheism, leaving one's homeland, and using possessions and lives when necessary, and forbidding the believers from turning away from His commands, while at that time they have already known and heard the call to obey His commands and help His struggle.

What is meant by hearing in this verse is understanding the Messenger's call and affirming it. As a believer, he should say when hearing the Messenger's call "samina wa athana" (we hear and we obey), as Allah says:

"The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, "We hear, and we obey." And it is those who are the successful." (an-Nur/24: 51)

And Allah also says:

"We make no distinction between any of His messengers." And they say, "We hear, and we obey." (al-Baqarah/2: 285)

What is meant by hearing the Messenger's call in this verse is obeying all of Allah's commands that are conveyed to him through revelation.
text.21:
Allah forbids the believers from acting like the hypocrites and the disbelievers. When they hear the Messenger's call, they act as if they hear it, but in reality, their hearts deny it. Therefore, the Muslims are forbidden from acting like them, who outwardly listen to the Prophet's call with full attention, when in fact they pay no attention whatsoever, let alone implement it.

In this verse, the hypocrites are declared as people who do not want to listen to the Prophet's words, namely embracing Islam. This indicates that they do not want to affirm at all what the Prophet calls for.

Allah says:

"And among them are those who listen to you, [O Muhammad], but when they leave you, they say to those who were given knowledge, "What has he said just now?" Those are the ones upon whose hearts Allah has sealed, and they have followed their [own] desires." (Muhammad/47: 16)
text.22:
Allah likens the hypocrites to the worst of animals, because they refuse to use their hearing to understand true calls and do not heed good advice.

The hypocrites are likened to animals in this verse, not in their physical form, but in their animalistic psychological traits. They reject understanding of Allah's words and refuse to contemplate and comprehend the truth. In this regard, they refuse to distinguish between true calls and false invitations, and between correct beliefs and erroneous beliefs.

Another reason for likening them to animals is because they refuse to speak the truth, as if they do not think, because they waste their intellect so that they cannot express the truth as it should be. If they used their intellect, they would surely listen to the call of the Messenger and follow him.

In this verse or other verses, Allah explains that the hypocrites are more misguided than animals.

Allah says:

"And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. They are like livestock; rather, they are [even] more astray. It is they who are the heedless." (al-Araf/7: 179)

Hearing and sight cannot be created by humans, because both are related to the soul, to life. Nothing can be expected from inanimate objects that have no hearing or sight. Even living hearing and sight are not functional if they are not directed.
text.23:
Allah makes a statement regarding the hypocrites and polytheists that if they had the will to believe and the hope to follow the guidance conveyed by the Messenger of Allah, then Allah would have made them able to hear. But because their innate capacity to receive Allah's guidance has been tainted with the stains of polytheism and hypocrisy, there is no other way to direct their innate capacities to receive guidance.

Even if Allah made them able to understand the Messenger's call, they would certainly be reluctant to carry out what they heard, let alone practice it, because denial and disbelief have nested in their hearts. From Allah's word, it can be understood that the degree to which people listen to the Messenger's call varies.

1. There are those who deliberately do not want to listen to the Messenger's call openly and meet it with hostility from the beginning, because they feel that his call will destroy their beliefs.

2. There are those who listen to the Messenger's call, but do not intend to understand and think about what is being called for, such as the hypocrites.

3. There are those who listen to the Messenger's call with the intention of finding an opportunity to refute and reject it. This is done by the polytheists and People of the Book who deny the truth of the verses of the Al-Quran.

4. There are those who listen with the intention of understanding and thinking about the Messenger's call. But sometimes Islamic teachings are used as knowledge for specific purposes, and sometimes Islamic teachings are used as material for discussion and targets of criticism. This is done by most orientalists.
text.24:
Allah calls upon the believers, that when Allah and His Messenger convey laws that are beneficial for their lives, they should respond to that call and accept it with full attention and strive to fulfill it. Because that call contains teachings that are beneficial for their lives, such as knowing the laws of Allah given to His creation, a life example that can be used as an example and a primary lesson to improve human values and elevate their lives to a perfect degree, so that they can take the straight path that brings them closer to God. Ultimately, they will live under the pleasure of Allah; in this world they will be happy and in the hereafter they will receive paradise. In another verse, the command to follow the Messenger is accompanied by the command to hold fast to it.

Allah says:

"Hold firmly to what We have given you and listen." (al-Baqarah/2: 93)

Obeying the Messenger is obligatory, both during his lifetime and after his death. Obeying the Messenger means obeying all kinds of his commands and avoiding his prohibitions contained in the Al-Quran and also contained in the books of hadith whose authenticity is known.

Allah commands the Muslims to truly know that Allah separates between man and his heart. This expression contains many meanings:

1. That Allah controls a person's heart, so Allah determines the inclination of that heart according to His will. Allah has the power to direct the heart of a disbeliever if He wills that the disbeliever receive guidance and controls the heart of a believer to mislead him if He wills to mislead him. A similar understanding is also found in the hadith narrated by al-Hakim in the Kitab al-Mustadrak from Ibn Abbas and from most of the salaf scholars.

Hadith that strengthen this understanding include that the Prophet Muhammad, often said:

"O Lord, the Turner of hearts, make my heart steadfast upon Your religion." Then the Messenger of Allah was asked, "O Messenger of Allah! We have believed in you and in the Book that you brought, so what are you worried about for us?" Then the Messenger of Allah replied, "Yes! Indeed, the heart is between two fingers of the fingers of the Lord. He is the One who turns it." (Narrated by Imam Ahmad and at-Tirmidzi from Anas).

2. That Allah commands His servants to hasten to obey Allah before the soul departs from the body, but they do not heed that command. This means that Allah kills his heart so that the good opportunity is lost, namely the loss of a person's opportunity to do good deeds and strive to treat the heart with various soul remedies so that his soul becomes healthy, according to the will of Allah. The words "separates" is a word used for the meaning of death, because it is the heart that usually can understand something, so if it is said that a person's heart has died, it means that a person's opportunity to utilize his knowledge is lost.

3. The word "yahulu" (separates) is a metaphorical word that describes the closest limit to a servant. Because something that separates two objects is very close to those two objects.

A similar understanding is quoted from Qatadah, because when discussing the meaning of the verse, he brought the word of Allah:

"And We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein." (Qaf/50: 16)

Whatever the differences of opinion among the mufassir regarding the interpretation of this verse, what cannot be denied is that Allah has created talents within a person. Good talents and bad talents can both develop according to the Sunnah of Allah that has been established for humans. The development of these talents depends on the situation, conditions and environment. If a person is well educated, his soul will become good. Conversely, if the soul is educated with evil, or is in an evil environment, the soul will become evil. The heart is the center of a person's feelings, abilities and will that can control his physical body to realize deeds.

It is fitting that in this verse it is said that Allah separates between a person and his heart, because Allah is the One who knows a person's conscience better. He is the One who controls the heart, because He is also the one who created the talents that are in the heart and He is also the most able to determine where the heart is directed.

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that indeed all humans will be gathered to Allah, in the Mahsyar field to be held accountable for all kinds of their deeds and receive retribution that is commensurate with their deeds.
text.25:
Allah calls upon the believers to protect themselves from a punishment that will not only befall the wrongdoers among them. The meaning is that if disobedience becomes widespread within a community, Allah will punish them all collectively. The punishment will not only be for those who commit the disobedience, but it will befall them all equally without discrimination, even if there are righteous people among them.

The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said:

"There is no community in which the majority of its people are more deceived into committing disobedience than those who do not, and then they do not change it, except that Allah will punish them with a widespread punishment." (Narrated by Ahmad from Jarir)

Therefore, within society, there is an institution that manages the welfare and manages *amar ma'ruf nahi munkar* (enjoining good and forbidding evil). This institution should be responsible for investigating the disobedience that arises in society, and also strive to find ways to prevent it. This institution also strives to encourage society to do everything that is commanded by religion and to stop everything that is forbidden. If disobedience has become widespread, and society has forgotten religion, then the disaster that will befall society will not only befall a certain group or class, but the disaster will be felt by members of society as a whole and equally.

At the end of this verse, Allah warns the believers that they should know that Allah is severe in His punishment. Allah's punishment is inflicted upon anyone who violates His law. This very severe threat from God will apply if evil has become rampant and widespread among all members of society indiscriminately. Meanwhile, His threats in the Hereafter are inflicted upon those who commit them according to the severity of the actions committed by that person.
text.26:
Allah reminds the Muslims of the blessings He bestowed upon them during the event of the Hijrah (migration). At that time, those who migrated from Mecca to Medina were few in number, and they belonged to the oppressed group. At the beginning of Islam, the Muslims were worried that the polytheists of Quraysh would kidnap them. Then Allah removed that worry. Allah gave them a safe place, which was Medina. After that, Allah gave assistance to the Muslims so that they became a strong ummah (community), whether in the form of assistance given by the Ansar (helpers) when the Prophet and his followers were in Medina, or the help Allah provided when they faced the polytheists in the Battle of Badr.

Allah also reminds the Muslims of another of His blessings, which is good and halal (lawful) sustenance, whether in the form of the prosperity of the land of Medina that they experienced or the victory in the Battle of Badr. The blessings of Allah given to the Muslims mentioned in these verses are to provide encouragement for the Muslims to be grateful for those blessings.
text.27:
Abdullah bin Abi Qatadah said, "This verse was revealed concerning Abu Lubabah when the Messenger of Allah (saw) besieged the tribe of Quraidhah and ordered them to accept Saad's decision. After that, Quraidhah consulted with Abu Lubabah about accepting Saad's decision, because Abu Lubabah's family and possessions were under their control. Then Quraidhah pointed to his neck (as a sign to be slaughtered). Abu Lubabah said, "Before my two feet moved, I knew that I had betrayed Allah and His Messenger." Then he swore not to eat anything until he died, or Allah accepted his repentance. Then he went to the mosque and tied himself to a pillar, and stayed there for several days until he fainted, because his body was very weak. Then Allah accepted his repentance. And he swore that he should not be released from his bonds except by the Messenger of Allah himself. Then he said, "O Messenger of Allah! I vow to give away my wealth as charity." The Messenger of Allah said, "It is enough to give a third as charity." (Narrated by Saad bin Manshur from Abdillah bin Abi Qatadah).

Allah calls upon the Muslims not to betray Allah and His Messenger, that is, to neglect the obligations that they must carry out, to violate His prohibitions, which have been determined through revelation. Not to betray the trust that has been entrusted to them, that is, to betray all kinds of matters relating to the order of the ummah, such as government affairs, war affairs, civil affairs, social affairs and the order of community life. To regulate all kinds of matters in society, there must be regulations that are obeyed by all members of society and by officials who are trusted to take care of the interests of the ummah.
